title: Pensioners win reverse mortgage reprieve
text:
Pensioners with reverse mortgages from the government are in line for interest rate relief that reflects cuts by the Reserve Bank.

The government will review the 5.25 per cent rate of interest charged on its pension loans scheme, which allows older people to borrow against some of the equity in their homes to boost fortnightly income.

In a story first reported in AFR Weekend on Saturday, Seniors Australia chief advocate Ian Henschke accused the government of gouging because it had not adjusted the 5.25 per cent figure downwards in line with a record low RBA rate of 0.75 per cent.

He spoke out after Mr Frydenberg announced an inquiry into banks for failing to pass on interest rate cuts to their customers in full.

"You cannot turn around and attack the banks while you are engaging in this sort of behaviour," Mr Henschke said.

By initiating the review, the government is signalling a small rate reduction for the 1100 pensioners who have reverse mortgages with the scheme.
description: Pensioners with reverse mortgages from the government are in line for interest rate relief to reflect cuts by the Reserve Bank.
